Robonigiri

The very first automatic onigiri maker!

Mechanics

Designing the rotary mechanism to shape and season the rice

Electronics/Firmware

Integrating servos into the mechanical design to press the rice

Software

Adding a GUI that relays commands to our system through this site

RobOnigiriâ€™s homepage

This website documents the full process we went through on our goal to build a simple onigiri snack maker!

What is Onigiri?

Onigiri are triangles of rice, often wrapped in seaweed, and sometimes contain filling (such as tuna, salmon) or toppings (like seaweed flakes, sesame seeds).

Our goals

Our main goal for this project was to create a device that can shape a pre-measured ball of rice into a triangle, as this is the basis for onigiri.

We did have some stretch goals which included:

  • Adding seaweed to the rice
  • Auto-weigh and dispense the rice
  • Add a seaweed dispenser
  • Add filling to the onigiri
  • Packgage the onigiri

Documentation

For a more detailed explanation of our process, feel free to explore the rest of the site!

Content

On this site you can find:

  • Our goals

  • Our design process and rationale
  • More information about our individual goals
  • Videos of the final system

Latest Updates

Sprint 2

Goal of Sprint 2

The goal of our second sprint was to integrate a mechanism which allowed us to add a strip of seaweed to the device, and incorporate the required food safety considerations after receiving feedback on this in our last sprint review.

Read more

Published: Nov 15, 2023

Sprint 1

Goal of Sprint 1

For our first sprint, our goal was to create a device that could compact something into a triangle. We used Play-Doh for testing at this phase. We had defined goals for each of the mechanical, software, and electrical components, although at this stage our work was mostly on the mechanical side of things.

Read more

Published: Nov 2, 2023
